introduction: We want to be part of your friendship journey, so we’ve created a few things you can share with new

vocabulary.definition: a temporary structure used to support a work in progress
vocabulary.example: The scaffolding around the building gave workers access to the higher floors.

vocabulary.definition: able to be endured or tolerated
vocabulary.example: The pain was bearable with the help of medication.
His disconnectedness from his family was evident in his lack of communication.

vocabulary.definition: a device or person that adjusts, sets, or standardizes a process
vocabulary.example: The technician used a calibrator to adjust the temperature sensor.

vocabulary.definition: a statement or proposition that seems self-contradictory or absurd but may express a possible truth
vocabulary.example: The friendship paradox suggests that most people have fewer friends than their friends do.

vocabulary.definition: the practice of exchanging things with others for mutual benefit
vocabulary.example: In friendships, reciprocity plays a key role in maintaining a balanced relationship.
